intro: Cheiridopsis pillansii var. crassa, commonly known as the thick-stemmed ice plant, is a succulent shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and fleshy, ribbed stems. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its slow growth and unique appearance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid gardens.
